most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update Causes Launch and Login Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0, including infinite loading during login, database corruption preventing startup, and invalid port errors. These problems were attributed to bugs introduced in the update, missing folders during installation, and insufficient installation privileges. Solutions involved bug fixes, manual folder creation, and using WinGet for installation with admin rights.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue conversation
**Problem**: Users reported experiencing infinite loading after logging in through pieces app or toolbar on Windows with Google/GitHub.

**Key Points:**
* Issue started after updating OS to v11.3.0.
* Problem occurred due to a bug introduced during a new flow update.
* Multiple users reported the problem on Windows 11.

**Proposed/Implemented Solution**:
* Pieces team investigated the bug causing the infinite loading.
* Fix deployed within several hours of identifying the bug.

**Current Status/ Outcome**:
* Authentication issue fixed.
* Users confirmed successful login following fix deployment. 
* Issue closed.
**Additional Details:**
Support logs requested from affected users to help diagnose issue.

[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* New user, antoine79, experienced initial bootup issues with their database.
* Support representative, mark-at-pieces, attempted to debug the issue in real-time but the problem persisted.
* Further investigation revealed a corruption in the database due to a missing subfolder.
* Antoine79 manually created the missing folder and discovered the core issue: their CPU lacked AVX2 support, which is required for the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension used by Pieces OS.
* Mark-at-pieces identified the core issue and developed a fix.
* The fix was released in version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS.

**Problems Identified:**

* Initial bootup issue with the database.
* Missing subfolder in the installation directory.
* Lack of AVX2 support on user's CPU, causing incompatibility with the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Real-time debugging by support representative.
* Manual creation of the missing subfolder by the user.
* Development of a fix by Pieces OS team to address the AVX2 support issue.
* Release of the fix in version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved.
* The fix is available in version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was difficult to reproduce due to the specific hardware configuration of the user's system.
* The fix addresses both the database corruption issue and the AVX2 support issue.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* SherlockSol reported an issue with an invalid port in Pieces Desktop.
* Similar issues had been reported previously.
* uzaxirr confirmed experiencing the same problem.
* zedevmed identified the issue as stemming from the lack of admin rights during installation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces Desktop was not launching due to an invalid port error.
* The .exe installer did not request admin rights, preventing proper port binding.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Nathan asked SherlockSol to share logs and hardware information.
* Mack suggested a video call for live troubleshooting.
* zedevmed proposed installing PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.
* Tsavo acknowledged the solution and suggested promoting the MSIX or winget installation method in the documentation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved by installing Pieces with admin privileges using WinGet.
* The team is working on updating the documentation to promote the recommended installation methods.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption on Startup
common_issues.description: Users experience app crashes or startup failures due to database corruption after updating to versions 11.0.0 and above. The issue can occur on both macOS and Windows, potentially linked to new plugin integration or missing subfolders in the installation directory. Solutions include bug fixes in later versions (11.3.2), manual creation of missing folders, and addressing CPU compatibility issues like AVX2 support for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Issue Summary

**Problem:** macOS user (@moazzem-pixel) reported the app crashing after updating to version 11.0.3 on their MacBook Air (2022) with M2 chip. They provided crash logs and error messages for analysis.

**Key points:**

* User was using macOS 12.3.
* They had Plugin A, B, and C installed.
* Problem started after updating from version 10.9.5.
* Expected behavior: App to launch and function normally.

**Solutions:**

* **Mark-at-Pieces suggested a similar issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686) for reference.**
* **Mark-at-Pieces recommended a support call if the issue wasn't the same.**
* **The problem was reportedly fixed in version 11.3.2.**

**Current status:** Issue resolved with the latest update (11.3.2). User advised to reopen the ticket if the problem persists.

**Note:** This summary only covers the information available in the provided conversation. Depending on the context, further analysis or clarification might be needed.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Moazzem-pixel reported an issue where Pieces OS wouldn't start due to database corruption.

**Problems identified:**

* The issue seems identical to another reported issue (#686).
* Duplication of issues may cause confusion and inefficiency.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces identified the existing issue (#686) and suggested continuing the conversation there.
* This helps consolidate discussion and avoids redundant troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Moazzem-pixel is directed to issue #686 for further assistance. 

**Additional Information:**

* The user was provided with helpful resources like existing issues, documentation, and YouTube videos.

**Overall:**

The conversation effectively identified a duplicate issue and directed the user to the correct location for support, streamlining communication and avoiding redundancy.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption on Startup
common_issues.description: Users encounter database corruption errors during Pieces OS startup on Windows and macOS. This often stems from missing folders, installation without admin rights, or CPU incompatibility (lack of AVX2 support). Solutions include reinstalling with admin rights, manually creating missing folders, and upgrading to Pieces OS 11.3.2 or later.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of database corruption issues:** This recurring problem causes startup failures and app crashes, significantly impacting user experience. **Consider a dedicated troubleshooting guide for database errors:** Given the frequency of database-related issues, create a dedicated section in the support documentation for troubleshooting these errors. Include common error messages, potential causes, and step-by-step solutions.
